panels.description: Ideally, this should be close to 1 to prevent the autoscaler from triggering unnecessarily. Higher means consumption is more than requested, lower means requests may be too high.

targets.expr:
sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{container="",pod!="", namespace=~"$namespaces"}[5m])) by (pod)
/
sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{resource="cpu", namespace=~"$namespaces"} * on(pod) group_left() (topk(1,kube_pod_status_phase{phase="Running"}==1) by (pod))) by (pod)

panels.title: CPU ratio consumed/requested

panels.description: Ideally this should be 0. Pods with a negative value consume more than they request, positive means they ask more than they consume.

targets.expr:
sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{resource="cpu", namespace=~"$namespaces"} * on(pod, namespace) group_left() (topk(1,kube_pod_status_phase{phase="Running"}==1) by (pod))) by (pod)
-
sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{container="",pod!="", namespace=~"$namespaces"}[5m])) by (pod)

panels.title: Cores wasted by pod

panels.description: This should also be close to 1, but it rarely leads to issues, so it's less critical.

targets.expr:
sum(rate(container_memory_usage_bytes{container="",pod!="", namespace=~"$namespaces"}[5m])) by (pod)
/
sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{resource="memory", namespace=~"$namespaces"} * on(pod) group_left() (topk(1,kube_pod_status_phase{phase="Running"}==1) by (pod))) by (pod)

panels.title: Ratio of memory consumed/requested

panels.description: Ideally this should be 0. Pods with a negative value consume more than they request, positive means they ask more than they consume.

targets.expr:
sum(kube_pod_container_resource_requests{resource="memory", namespace=~"$namespaces"} * on(pod, namespace) group_left() (topk(1,kube_pod_status_phase{phase="Running"}==1) by (pod))) by (pod)
-
sum(rate(container_memory_working_set_bytes{container="",pod!="", namespace=~"$namespaces"}[5m])) by (pod)

panels.title: Memory wasted by pod

panels.description: Ideally this should be 0. Pods with a negative value consume more than they request, positive means they ask more than they consume.
panels.title: Memory used by pod
